thread.section_title: Arts and Entertainment coverage for all ages and interests - San Francisco Chronicle
thread.title: Denise Hale’s beautifully drawn luncheon for artist David Downton
thread.title_full: Denise Hale’s beautifully drawn luncheon for artist David Downton - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Tony Bravo
title: Denise Hale’s beautifully drawn luncheon for artist David Downton
text:
“David Downton: Portraits of the World’s Most Stylish Women.” “David Downton: Portraits of the World’s Most Stylish Women.”
Before her 20-plus luncheon guests arrive at the Cavalier, Denise Hale circles the tables reserved in the back of the Jessie Street hot spot and puts a handwritten place card at each setting. As she sets one at the place of the guest of honor, fashion illustrator and celebrity portrait artist David Downton, the eye notices the kind of touch that makes an invitation to a Denise Hale party such an occasion: Each card is emblazoned with the artist’s portrait of the hostess, the same one that draws itself with an invisible hand before episodes of PBS’ “Downton Abbey,” noting Hale’s sponsorship of the series. “David Downton: Portraits of the World’s Most Stylish Women.” “David Downton: Portraits of the World’s Most Stylish Women.”
Before her 20-plus luncheon guests arrive at the Cavalier, Denise Hale circles the tables reserved in the back of the Jessie Street hot spot and puts a handwritten place card at each setting. As she sets one at the place of the guest of honor, fashion illustrator and celebrity portrait artist David Downton, the eye notices the kind of touch that makes an invitation to a Denise Hale party such an occasion: Each card is emblazoned with the artist’s portrait of the hostess, the same one that draws itself with an invisible hand before episodes of PBS’ “Downton Abbey,” noting Hale’s sponsorship of the series.
